Crank and Cams

Crank and Cams contains any crank and cam components in the referenced FPGA. Crank and Cams define the simulated crank and cam profiles used for Engine Simulation.

What do you want to do?

Add crank or cam(s)

To add crank or cam(s), click the Add Crank/Cam(s) button. You also can right-click Crank and Cams in the configuration tree and select Add Crank or Cam(s) from the shortcut menu.

Remove crank or cam(s)

To remove a single crank or cam, select the crank or cam name in the configuration tree and click the red X button.

To remove multiple crank and cams, click the Remove Crank/Cam(s) button. You also can right-click Crank and Cams in the configuration tree and select Remove Crank or Cam(s) from the shortcut menu.

View or change a crank or cam

To view or change a crank or cam, select the crank or cam item in the configuration tree. The Crank or Cam Configuration page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

For more information about adding and configuring custom devices, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
